title: RAPID Hand: A Robust, Affordable, Perception-Integrated, Dexterous Manipulation Platform for Generalist Robot Autonomy
description: RAPID Hand is a low-cost, 20-DoF robotic hand platform with integrated vision and tactile sensing, designed for precise teleoperation and high-quality data collection in dexterous manipulation tasks.

title: GET: Goal-directed Exploration and Targeting for Large-Scale Unknown Environments
description: GET is a framework for object search that combines LLM reasoning with experience-based exploration, using DoUT for real-time decisions and a probabilistic task map for updating location priors, achieving superior performance in dynamic environments.

title: Prior Does Matter: Visual Navigation via Denoising Diffusion Bridge Models
description: We propose a novel imitation learning framework for visual navigation using a diffusion bridge model, utilizing an informative prior action instead of Gaussian noise as the denoising start point to improve generation efficiency and performance.

title: Layer-wise feature refinement for accurate three-dimensional lane detection with enhanced bird’s eye view transformation
description: This work proposes a lightweight 3D lane detection method for autonomous driving using a dual-branch view transformation with deformable convolution and geometric priors, plus cross-attention with spatial encoding. Layer-wise BEV refinement improves multi-level feature use, yielding higher F1-scores than existing methods.

title: NaviDiffusor: Cost-Guided Diffusion Model for Visual Navigation
description: This work presents a hybrid visual navigation method combining classical planning with a conditional diffusion model using only RGB input. It guides path generation via gradient-based cost functions without retraining, enabling zero-shot generalization across diverse environments and outperforming baselines in success and safety.

title: Refinement Bird’s Eye View Feature for 3D Lane Detection with Dual-Branch View Transformation Module
description: This paper proposes an efficient 3D lane detection method using a dual-branch view transformation with deformable convolutions and view relation modeling. An auxiliary head and progressive BEV refinement boost accuracy, achieving higher F1-scores and strong adaptability with low computational cost.

title: Adaptive Patchwork: Real-Time Ground Segmentation for 3D Point Cloud With Adaptive Partitioning and Spatial-Temporal Context
description: Adaptive Patchwork is a 3D LiDAR ground segmentation method that improves on Patchwork++ via adaptive partitioning, spatio-temporal correction, and multi-feature noise removal. It achieves higher accuracy and faster performance on SemanticKITTI and Koblenz datasets than state-of-the-art methods.
